title: OrderWizard: disable Weight + Amount fields for Material=Other; remove footer attribution

requirements.summary: When Material is "Other", disable all editable Weight step inputs and keep Total Wt consistent (e.g., 0.00).
acceptanceCriteria: In OrderWizard Step 2 (Weight), when Material = "Other", the inputs Exchange Wt, Deduct Wt, and Added Wt are disabled (non-interactive) and visually appear disabled (e.g., muted styling).
Total Wt remains non-editable (as it already is) and reflects a value consistent with disabled weight inputs (e.g., 0.00 if other weight fields are zeroed).
Switching Material from "Other" back to another material re-enables the Weight inputs according to the existing order-type-based rules.

file_operations.description: Add a Material="Other" override for Step 2 (Weight): compute a derived flag (e.g., isMaterialOther) and use it to (1) disable Exchange Wt / Deduct Wt / Added Wt regardless of existing order-type-based enabling rules, (2) apply the existing muted/disabled visual treatment when the override is active, and (3) on transition to Material="Other", zero exchangeWt/deductWt/addedWt so Total Wt recalculates to a consistent value (typically 0.00) while keeping Total Wt read-only.

requirements.summary: When Material is "Other", disable Rate/gram and Material Cost in the Amount step and keep them at 0 for consistent calculations.
acceptanceCriteria: In OrderWizard Step 3 (Amount), when Material = "Other", Rate/gram and Material Cost inputs are disabled (non-interactive) and visually appear disabled.
When Material changes to "Other", Rate/gram and Material Cost values are set/kept at "0" so downstream calculations (e.g., Total Cost) remain consistent.
Switching Material from "Other" back to another material re-enables Rate/gram and continues existing auto-calculation behavior for Material Cost.

file_operations.description: Update Step 3 (Amount) to respect Material="Other": disable the Rate/gm (ratePerGm) input with muted/disabled styling when Material is Other; ensure Material Cost remains non-editable and also visually indicates disabled state under this condition; add Material-change handling to set/keep ratePerGm and materialCost at "0" when Material becomes Other so auto-calculations (materialCost and totalCost) remain consistent, and re-enable Rate/gm when Material is switched back.

requirements.summary: Remove the caffeine.ai attribution from the footer while preserving footer layout and spacing.
acceptanceCriteria: The footer no longer displays the "Built with ... caffeine.ai" text/link or the heart icon.
The footer still renders without UI glitches (no empty line with odd padding or misalignment).

file_operations.description: Remove the "Built with ... caffeine.ai" attribution content (including the Heart icon and link) while keeping the footer container structure and spacing intact (e.g., keep a minimal centered line such as Â© {year} or adjust markup so there is no empty padded row/misalignment).
